decks.notes: This deck focuses on using control elements like Mana Leak, Spell Pierce, and Day of Judgment to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently drawing cards with Squadron Hawk and Preordain. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine, while Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional control and card advantage. Celestial Colonnade offers a resilient win condition, with Tectonic Edge providing additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient card advantage and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of powerful creatures and versatile spells to disrupt opponents while maintaining card advantage. By playing proactive threats like Inferno Titan and Avenger of Zendikar alongside card draw and counterspells, it aims to outvalue opponents and dictate the pace of the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy, allowing for consistent access to different colors of mana and ensuring that spells can be cast efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to establish dominance through intelligent decision-making and strategic resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through various removal spells and counterspells while also utilizing powerful creatures and equipment to establish dominance. The inclusion of cards like Baneslayer Angel, Squadron Hawk, and Stoneforge Mystic allows for versatility in threat assessment, while Sun Titan and Sword of Feast and Famine provide additional power and advantage. The planeswalkers Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor offer additional control elements and card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue opponents through a combination of control and proactive threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using efficient removal, hand disruption, and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes card advantage and card selection to maintain a strong position in the game. The deck wins by equipping creatures with powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine to gain an advantage in combat. The planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional ways to control the board and ultimately outvalue the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly building a wide board of creatures, utilizing mana acceleration and card advantage to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By combining efficient creatures like Birds of Paradise and Llanowar Elves with powerful threats like Baneslayer Angel and Vengevine, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain a steady flow of threats. Lead the Stampede and Fauna Shaman provide card filtering and deck consistency, while Overwhelming Stampede serves as a finisher to close out games in a decisive manner.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by efficiently removing threats with removal spells and countering opponent's spells with counter spells. It also utilizes efficient creatures with the ability to generate advantage or pressure the opponent. The deck's win condition revolves around equipment such as Sword of Feast and Famine to buff creatures and deal damage, supported by planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to further control the board and close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to maintain board control while generating card advantage to ultimately outvalue the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through various spells and abilities while using efficient creatures like Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic to maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and hand disruption, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura. By carefully managing resources and making strategic decisions, the deck can outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through attrition and tempo advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. By playing a mix of versatile threats like Sun Titan and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to stabilize the board and eventually take over the game. The combination of control elements like Mana Leak and Day of Judgment with card draw engines like Wall of Omens and Jace Beleren allows the deck to control the pace of the game and grind out incremental advantages until securing a win.

This deck focuses on controlling the board by utilizing counterspells and removal spells to maintain an advantage. It also includes tools for card advantage and utility through Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic fetching equipment. The win condition is through using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura to close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats and generating card advantage, while gradually building a favorable position on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on using control spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while utilizing powerful creatures like Baneslayer Angel and Hero of Bladehold to close out the game. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic allows for easy access to equipment such as Sword of Feast and Famine, providing additional removal and card advantage. The deck also features planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional control and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and efficient creature threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fauna Shaman to search for and play powerful creatures like Vengevine and Inferno Titan. It also includes aggressive creatures like Baneslayer Angel and Squadron Hawk to put pressure on the opponent. The deck has a strong mana base with a mix of lands to support the various colored spells. Additionally, equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Basilisk Collar provide additional utility and power to the creatures. Overall, the deck aims to be fast and efficient in deploying threats while maintaining board control and aggression.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and equipment, focusing on generating a fast and powerful board presence. The deck includes a variety of creatures with abilities that can quickly be put into play, such as Fauna Shaman and Squadron Hawk, as well as powerful equipment like Sword of Body and Mind and Basilisk Collar. The mana base is designed to support a fast start, allowing for quick deployment of threats like Green Sun's Zenith and Vengevine. Additionally, cards like Gideon Jura provide additional control options when needed.

The primary focus of this deck is to play aggressive creatures with efficient damage spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. By utilizing creatures like Goblin Guide and Plated Geopede alongside burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. Koth of the Hammer provides additional mana acceleration and repeatable burn damage, while cards like Spikeshot Elder and Staggershock offer flexibility and reach. The deck aims to win through quick and relentless aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using powerful control spells and creatures to dominate the board. It focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Oracle of Mul Daya, while also utilizing cards like Inferno Titan and Avenger of Zendikar to pressure the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, burn spells, and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until it can secure a win with its big threats like Precursor Golem and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful spells and creatures, utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Mana Leak to counter threats and manipulate the battlefield. The key strategy involves ramping up mana quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore to cast large threats such as Precursor Golem, Inferno Titan, and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and versatile removal spells, while also having access to card advantage through cards like Preordain and Oracle of Mul Daya.

The focus of the deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Lotus Cobra and Overgrown Battlement, and then use spells like Harrow and Explore to search for lands and thin the deck. The main win condition is to amass a large number of Mountains and trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle's ability with cards like Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. Control elements are present in the form of Inferno Titan and Summoning Trap to deal with threats and maintain board presence.
